column1: comments  74$We spent two nights here en route to the South of France. Hotel was very quiet as it was August & French summer holidays. Nice family room over two floors with a double

column1: comments  106$We were going to be getting to the hotel late on the day we checked in. Our travel plans allowed us to stop by in the morning and we talked to the owner. The room wasn't ready

column3: quiet town - it was a great place to stay. The breakfast was also exceptional.

column1: comments  238$Arrived at the hotel and was not recognisable as a best western from the outside
column2: on arrival the front desk was helpful and friendly
column3: whilst checking in they asked for a credit card to be swiped and took €100 from it
column4: on checking out they said it would be put back on my card
column5: but a week later I am still waiting for that to happen and is a payment pending on my card. When having a look around the hotel we looked in the bistro to see what was on offer that evening
column6: but no menu or anyone around to ask. Whilst checking in the reception said the bar would open at 5.30pm so you could have a drink before dining but this was not the case as it didn’t open. There wasn’t much around the hotel to go and eat or drink out.Maybe we caught them on a bad night.

column1: comments  241$It was a great location for going to the Lyon Stadium. We were there for the Fifa Women’s World Cup and it was a great choice.
